declarations.comments: `Vec s a` is an array with a fixed size `s` defined at the type level.
declarations.title: Vec

declarations.comments: An empty vector.
declarations.title: empty

declarations.comments: Prepend a value to the front of a vector, creating a vector of size `Succ s`.
declarations.title: cons

declarations.comments: Append a value to the end of a vector, creating a vector of size `Succ s`.
declarations.title: snoc

declarations.comments: Get the head and the tail of a non-empty vector.
declarations.title: uncons

declarations.comments: Construct a vector containing only a single element.
declarations.title: singleton

declarations.comments: Construct a vector of a given length containing the same element repeated.
declarations.title: replicate

declarations.comments: Get the length of a vector as an integer.
declarations.title: length

declarations.comments: Get the length of a vector as a type level number.
declarations.title: lengthT

declarations.comments: Convert a vector into an array. This simply unwraps the underlying array, so it has no runtime cost.
declarations.title: toArray

declarations.comments: Convert a vector into any `Unfoldable`.
declarations.title: toUnfoldable

declarations.comments:
Get the element at a given index inside a vector. Index out of bounds errors
are caught at compile time.

Example:

    myVector = 1 +> 2 +> 3 +> 4 +> empty
    value = index myVector d2
    -- value == 3
    value = index myVector d4
    -- out of bounds so does not type check
declarations.title: index

declarations.comments: Concatenate two vectors together.
declarations.title: concat

declarations.comments: Update a vector with a given value inserted at a given index.
declarations.title: updateAt

declarations.comments: Update a vector at a given index using a function.
declarations.title: modifyAt

declarations.comments:
Insert a value at a given index inside a vector, returning a vector
that is one element larger.
declarations.title: insertAt

declarations.comments:
Remove an element at a given index inside a vector, returning a vector
that is one element smaller.
declarations.title: deleteAt

declarations.comments: Get the head of a non-empty vector.
declarations.title: head

declarations.comments: Get the last element of a non-empty vector.
declarations.title: last

declarations.comments: Get the tail of a non-empty vector.
declarations.title: tail

declarations.comments: Get all but the last element of a non-empty vector.
declarations.title: init

declarations.comments: Insert an element into a sorted vector.
declarations.title: insert

declarations.comments: Insert an element into a sorted vector using an ordering function.
declarations.title: insertBy

declarations.comments: Get a sub-vector from index `i1` up to but not including index `i2`.
declarations.title: slice

declarations.comments: Get the first `c` elements from a vector.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Drop the first `c` elements from a vector.
declarations.title: drop

declarations.comments:
Zip two vectors together into a vector of tuples.

The new vector will be the size of the smallest input vector, and
superfluous elements from the other will be discarded.
declarations.title: zip

declarations.comments:
Zip two vectors together using a combining function.

The new vector will be the size of the smallest input vector, and
superfluous elements from the other will be discarded.
declarations.title: zipWith

declarations.comments: Unzip a vector of tuples into a tuple of vectors.
declarations.title: unzip

declarations.comments: Sort a vector of `Ord`s.
declarations.title: sort

declarations.comments: Sort a vector using an ordering function.
declarations.title: sortBy

declarations.comments: Reverse a vector.
declarations.title: reverse
